details.top: One repeats just as the mu'adhdhin [one who calls to prayer] says, except when he says:
details.arabic_diacless: حي على الصلاة وحي على الفلاح
details.arabic: حَيَّ عَلَى الصَّلاَةِ وَحَيَّ عَلَى الْفَلَاحِ
details.translations: Hasten to the prayer, Hasten to Success

details.arabic_diacless: لا حول ولا قوة إلا باللٰه
details.arabic: لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللّٰهِ
details.transliteration: Laa hawla wa laa quwwata 'illaa billaah.
details.translations: There is no might and no power except by Allah. [1]

details.top: Immediately following the declaration of faith called by the mu'adhdhin, one says:
details.arabic_diacless: وأنا أشهد أن لا إلٰه إلا اللٰه وحده لا شريك له وأن محمدا عبده ورسوله، رضيت باللٰه ربا، وبمحمد رسولا، وبالإسلام دينا
details.arabic: وَأَنَا أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ، رَضِيْتُ بِاللّٰهِ رَبًّا، وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ رَسُولًا، وَبِالْإِسْلَامِ دِيْنًا
details.transliteration: Wa 'anaa '-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu wa 'anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa Rasooluhu, radheetu billaahi Rabban, wa bi-Muhammadin Rasoolan wa bil'islaami deenan.
details.translations: I  witness that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner, and that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger. I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Muhammad as my Messenger and with Islam as my religion. [2, 3]

details.top: After replying to the call of mu'adhdhin. you should recite in Arabic Allah's blessings on the Prophet. [4]
details.arabic_diacless: اللٰهم رب هٰذه الدعوة التامة، والصلاة القائمة، آت محمدا الوسيلة والفضيلة، وابعثه مقاما محمودا الذي وعدته، إنك لا تخلف الميعاد
details.arabic: اَللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّ هٰذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ، وَالصَّلَاةِ الْقَائِمَةِ، آتِ مُحَمَّدًا الْوَسِيْلَةَ وَالْفَضِيْلَةَ، وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَامًا مَحْمُوْدًا الَّذِيْ وَعَدتَّهُ، إِنَّكَ لَا تُخْلِفُ الْمِيْعَادَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma Rabba haa<u>th</u>ihid-da 'watit-taammati wassalaatil-qaa'imati, 'aati Muhammadanil-waseelata walfadheelata, wab 'ath-hu maqaamam-mahmoodanil-la<u>th</u>ee wa'adtahu, ['innaka laa tukhliful-mee'aad]
details.translations: O Allah, Lord of this perfect call and established prayer. Grant Muhammad the intercession and favor, and raise him to the honored station You have promised him, [verily You do not neglect promises] . [5]
details.bottom: Between the call to prayer and the 'Iqamah, you should supplicate Allah for yourself. Invocation during this time is not rejected. [6]
details.reference:
[1] Al-Bukhari 1/152, Muslim 1/288.
[2] Muslim 1/290.
[3] Ibn Khuzaymah 1/220.
[4] Muslim 1/288.
[5] Al-Bukhari 1/152, and the addition between brackets is from Al-Bayhaqi 1/410 with a good (Hasan) chain of narration. See 'Abdul-Azlz bin Baz's Tuhfatul-'Akhyar, pg. 38.
[6] At-Tirmidhi, Abu Dawud, Ahmad, See also Al-Albani, Irwa ul-Ghalil 1/262
